div.p: Centralia R-VI continues to monitor the status of COVID-19 and is actively working on plans related to prevention and alternative instructional options for students should they be necessary. We are in regular contact with lead health agencies and are working directly with various state and local entities. We are also following guidance related to school closures from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC). Information on school closures from the CDC is available here.
Events may be canceled or receive attendance limits if the District believes it is reasonable to predict unnecessary risk. Such action will be communicated appropriately.

ul.li: Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds
Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth
Stay home if you feel sick
Cover your mouth/nose with a tissue or sleeve when coughing/sneezing
Avoid sharing drinks, water bottles or silverware with others

div.p: Students exhibiting the following symptoms will be sent home and/or should remain at home if they exhibit any of the following:

ul.li: Vomiting with associated signs of illness
Ongoing symptoms of discomfort or immobility from an injury
A concerning health condition that may require further medical evaluation, this may include
respiratory symptoms in combination with other symptoms

section.div:
The Centralia Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, or use of leave protected by the Family and Medical Leave Act, in its programs, activities, or with regard to employment. The Centralia Board of Education is an equal opportunity employer. For inquiries regarding IDEA compliance and/or Section 504 regulations, contact Cristina Heet at 1399 East Highway 22, Centralia, MO 65240, (573) 682-3561.
